                                    Section A

     Question             Answers                                 Notes                     Total
1.     a                                        Correct labels of axes required for mark.
                                                                         1
                                                Accept d –1 instead of     .
                                                                         d




                OR


                                                                         1
                                                Accept I –1 instead of     .
                                                                         I
                                                                                             1




                OR
                I
                                                Plot of I vs d should not be linear.




                     d✔
                                                               –4–                    N17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                        Answers                         Notes                   Total
1.     b    i     negative correlation
                  OR
                  model/prediction matches results                                                            1
                  OR
                  99% of variance accounted for ✔

1.     b    ii    I   0.001631 d  0.09939                         Accept correctly rounded values for m
                                                                     and b in equation.
                  OR                                                                                          1
                                                                     Do not accept “y  mx  b”.
                  y   0.001631 x  0.09939 ✔

1.     b    iii   ions move «across electrolyte» ✔

                                                                                                              1
                                                                    –5–                     N17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                        Answers                                Notes                  Total

2.     a        Mg(OH)2 (s)  2HCl (aq)  MgCl2 (aq)  2H2O (l) ✔         Accept full or net ionic equation.         1

2.     b        Any two from:                                             Accept “number of tablets/different
                volume «of HCl» ✔                                         doses”.
                                                                          Do not accept “same pH meter” OR
                concentration «of HCl»/[HCl] ✔
                                                                          “initial pH” OR “concentration of
                temperature «of HCl» ✔                                   antacid/[antacid]”.

                mass of antacid/tablets ✔
                                                                          A variable must be given so do not       2 max
                size of antacid particles/tablets
                                                                          accept answers such as “stirring”,
                OR                                                        “whether tablets are whole or crushed”
                                                                          etc.
                surface area of antacid «particles»/tablets ✔




2.     c         0.04
                OR                                                                                                   1
                 0.03 ✔
                                                                        –6–                               N17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                       Answers                                               Notes                   Total
2.     d        Any two of:
                uncertainty «(0.04/(0.03» means A and C cannot be distinguished ✔
                each measurement was conducted once ✔
                stomach pH should not be raised a lot «so antacid B is not necessarily
                effective» ✔
                mass/number of tablets/dose «of antacid» used was not controlled ✔       Accept “amount of tablets” for “dose”.

                actual environment in stomach is different ✔                            Do not accept “nature/composition of     2 max
                                                                                         tablets differs”.
                                                                                         Accept an answer such as “time frame
                                                                                         is too short since some antacids could
                                                                                         be long-acting drugs if they contain a
                                                                                         gelatinisation/delaying agent” but not
                                                                                         just “time frame is too short since
                                                                                         some antacids could be long-acting
                                                                                         drugs”.

                                                                                        1

                                             27 to 29 «%».




                                                                                        1




                28 «%» ✔

     Question                                          Answers                                                      Notes                    Total
3.     c        Mr  94.48 ✔                                                                       Award M2 only if answer is to 2 decimal
                                                                                                   places.
                     (1.01  2  16.00)
                «2                       100 » 38.15 «%» ✔                                       Award [2] for correct final answer.        2
                           94.48
                                                                                                   Award [1 max] for 38.10 %.

3.     d        rust/corrosion «of cars and bridges»                                               Do not accept “tyre damage”.
                OR                                                                                 Do not accept “economic issues” OR
                waste of important raw material                                                    “environmental issues” unless specified
                                                                                                   (eg accept “increase in costs for local
                OR                                                                                 councils road budgets” but not “cost”
                soil/water salination/pollution «from run off»                                     alone).

                OR                                                                                 Do not accept “makes roads more
                                                                                                   slippery”.
                erosion of/damage to the road surface
                                                                                                                                              1
                OR
                specific example of damage to the ecosystem
                OR
                «outdoor» temperatures may go below effective levels for NaCl «to lower freezing
                point» so NaCl could be wasted
                OR
                roads can refreeze causing hazards ✔

                                                                      Section B
Option A — Materials

   Question                                          Answers                                                   Notes                    Total
4.   a          Alloy:
                mixture of metal with other metals/non-metals
                OR
                mixture of elements that retains the properties of a metal ✔

                                                                                                                                          2
                Composite:
                reinforcing phase embedded in matrix phase ✔                                  Award [1 max] for implying “composites
                                                                                              only have heterogeneous/non-
                                                                                              homogeneous compositions”.



4.   b          difference in ionic/atomic radius prevents layers sliding over each other ✔   Accept “difference in diameter/packing
                                                                                              of cations prevents layers sliding over     1
                                                                                              each other”.
4.   c          Any three of:
                sample injected into argon «plasma» ✔
                atoms «of sample» are excited/ionised
                OR
                electrons are promoted ✔                                                                                                3 max
                electrons drop back/recombine with ions AND emit photons of characteristic
                energies/wavelengths/frequencies ✔
                total number of photons is proportional to concentration of element ✔
                actual concentration found from calibration/standard curve ✔                  Accept "graph/plot" for "curve".
                                                                           – 10 –   N17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                         Answers                       Notes                Total
5.              Any two of:
                greater selectivity ✔
                higher efficiency ✔
                longer life expectancy
                OR
                not easily poisoned ✔                                                                   2 max
                easier to recover ✔
                low«er» environmental impact ✔
                large range of conditions/temperatures/pressures supported ✔
                lower energy costs ✔
                increase in yield «per unit time» offsets cost of catalyst ✔
                                                                           – 11 –                    N17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                         Answers                                        Notes                      Total
6.     a         Any two of:                                                        Accept “ability of molecules to transmit
                                                                                    light under certain conditions” OR “rod-
                 ability to form a LC phase ✔
                                                                                    shaped molecules” OR “stable to
                 chemically stable ✔                                                light/not light sensitive”.

                 «LC phase that is» stable over suitable temperature range ✔
                                                                                                                                2 max
                 polar
                 OR
                 being able to change orientation with applied electric field ✔
                 rapid switching speed «responds to changes of voltage quickly» ✔

6.     b         Any two of:
                 have higher critical temperatures/Tc «than Type 1»                 Do not accept “Type 2 has a gradual
                                                                                    transition to a superconducting state but
                 OR
                                                                                    in Type 1 it is a sharp transition”.
                 can act at higher temperatures ✔                                                                               2 max
                 have higher critical magnetic fields/Bc «than Type 1» ✔
                 less time needed to cool to operating temperature ✔
                 less energy required to cool down/maintain low temperature ✔

6.     c    i    Fe(CO)5 (g)  Fe (s)  5CO (g) ✔
                                                                                                                                  2
                 2CO (g)  C (s)  CO2 (g) ✔

6.     c    ii   large surface area «on which carbon nanotubes form» ✔                                                            1
                                                                       – 12 –                    N17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                       Answers                                      Notes                    Total
7.     a        branching in LDPE prevents close packing «of chains» ✔          Do not accept “difference in density”.
                LDPE is more flexible/less rigid
                OR                                                              Award [1 max] for stating “branching in    2
                                                                                LDPE AND little/no branching in
                LDPE has lower «tensile» strength ✔                             HDPE”.


7.     b        addition: C=C                                                   Accept "alkene/alkenyl" OR "double
                                                                                bond" OR "multiple bond".
                AND                                                                                                        1
                condensation: two functional groups needed on each monomer ✔

7.     c        hydrogen bonds ✔                                                Accept “ – stacking/interactions”.       1

7.     d        B AND absence of «absorption of» C–H at 2850–3090 «cm–1»
                OR                                                                                                         1
                B AND presence of «absorption of» C–F at 1000–1400 «cm–1» ✔

7.     e        (C2H3Cl)2 (s)  5O2 (g)  4CO2 (g)  2H2O (l)  2HCl (g)      Accept “(C2H3Cl)2 (s)  5.5O2 (g) 
                correct species in reactants and products ✔
                                                                                 4CO2 (g)  3H2O (l)  Cl2 (g)”.
                                                                                                                           2
                                                                                Award M2 only if M1 correct.
                balanced ✔

9.     a        adsorption                                                           Accept other valid methods such as
                OR                                                                   “phytoremediation” OR “Fenton
                                                                                     reaction” OR “electrolysis”.
                chelation                                                                                                      1
                OR
                ion exchange ✔

9.     b        Calculation:
                Ksp  [Cd2+]  [S2–] ✔
                [Cd2+]  8.0  10–26 «mol dm–3» ✔                                    Award [2] for correct numerical answer
                                                                                     of [Cd2+] for M1 and M2.

                Assumption:
                                                                                                                               3
                volume of solution remains 1.0 dm3
                OR
                concentration of sulfide ions in original solution is negligible     Accept “0.10 + x  0.10 «mol dm–3»”.
                OR
                hydrolysis of sulfide ions is negligible ✔

10.   a   ii   ratio of oxygen to carbon in linoleic acid lower                                      Accept «average» oxidation state of
                                                                                                     carbon in linoleic acid is lower”.
               OR
               linoleic acid less oxidized                                                                                                   1
               OR
               linoleic acid more reduced ✔

10.   b               1.24 g                                                                         Award [3] for correct final answer.
               «                 1
                                      » 0.00442 «mol» ✔
                   280.50 gmol
               0.00884 mol of C=C
               OR                                                                                                                            3

10.   c      Any two of:                                              Accept "essential fatty acid".
                                                                      Do not accept “bad cholesterol” for
             increases «ratio of» HDL «to LDL» cholesterol            “LDL cholesterol” OR “good cholesterol”
             OR                                                       for “HDL cholesterol”.

             decreases LDL cholesterol «level» ✔
                                                                      Do not accept general answers such as
                                                                      “source of energy” OR “forms
             removes plaque from/unblocks arteries                    triglycerides” OR "regulates permeability
                                                                                                                  2 max
             OR                                                       of cell membranes" etc.

             decreases risk of heart disease ✔


             decreases risk of stroke «in the brain» ✔
             

                                                                                   inhibition is correctly described.

               same Vmax reached at higher [substrate] ✔

             active site altered                                                          enzyme to form complex with
             OR                                                                           substrate”.

             tertiary structure altered ✔

             acidic/basic/ionizable/COOH/carboxyl/NH2/amino groups in the R groups/side

                                                                                               as ammonia, ethanoic/acetic acid,
             small/tiny molecule                                                               ethanol, hydrogen sulfide etc. for M2.
             OR

                                                                                               equation of a condensation reaction

12.   c      Any two of:
             makes the plastic more hydrophilic/water soluble ✔


             carbohydrates are broken down/hydrolysed by bacteria/microorganisms ✔


             makes plastic more accessible to bacteria as holes/channels are created                                             2 max
             OR
             plastic of lower density is more permeable/susceptible to
             water/oxygen/heat/pressure ✔


             weakens intermolecular/London/dispersion/instantaneous induced dipole-    Accept “van der Waals/vdW” for “London”
             induced dipole forces «between polymer chains in the plastic» ✔           forces.

             hydrogen/H-bonds                                                          dipole interactions” stated for water
                                                                                       and/or proteins.
             OR
             ion-dipole interactions ✔


             Proteins:                                                                                                             2
             ionic bonds/interactions
             OR

             OR
             ion-dipole interactions ✔

                                                                       – 23 –                               N17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


  Question                                         Answers                                                 Notes                 Total
15.   a      «mainly» hydrocarbon/non-polar «structure» ✔
             forms London/dispersion/instantaneous induced dipole-induced dipole forces
             «with fats» ✔                                                                Accept “forms van der Waals’/vdW
                                                                                          forces".                                 2
                                                                                          Award [1 max] for “contains only one
                                                                                          OH/hydroxyl AND cannot form
                                                                                          «enough» H-bonds”.

15.   b      Any three of:
             cis-retinal binds to «the protein» opsin
             OR
             cis-retinal «binds to opsin and» forms rhodopsin ✔


             rhodopsin extends conjugation in retinal
             OR
             rhodopsin allows absorption of visible/blue/green light ✔                                                          3 max


             when visible light is absorbed cis-retinal changes to trans-retinal ✔        Do not accept “cis-retinal to trans-
                                                                                          retinal” alone without reference to
             change «to trans-retinal» triggers an electrical/nerve signal ✔             absorption of visible light.

             trans-retinal detaches from opsin AND is converted back to cis-retinal
             OR
             trans-retinal is converted back to cis-retinal through enzyme activity ✔

Option C — Energy

   Question                                          Answers                                                     Notes                     Total
16.   a        Mr (C8H18)  114.26 AND ∆H Ö
                                          c  –5470 «kJ mol » ✔
                                                           –1                                   Award [2] for correct final answer.
                                     5470 kJ
               «specific energy                 » 4.79  104/47873/47900 «kJ kg–1» ✔
                                    0.11426 kg                                                  Accept “48 ╳ 103 «kJ kg－1»” OR               2
                                                                                                “47.9 ╳ 103 «kJ kg－1»”.


16.   b        wood is less useful because it requires «about three times» more mass for same   Accept “octane is more useful because
               energy ✔                                                                         it has higher specific energy”.              1

16.   c        Any one of:                                                                      Accept “biofuel/biodiesel/«bio»ethanol”,
                                                                                                but not just “water” or “fuel cells”.
               wind ✔
               tidal/wave ✔
               hydro-electric ✔                                                                                                            1 max
               solar ✔
               thermal/geothermal ✔
               plant oil ✔
                                                                   – 25 –                     N17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


  Question                                      Answers                                       Notes                     Total
17.   a      CH3CH2CH2CH2CH2CH2CH3  CH3CH(CH3)CH2CH(CH3)2                  A structural formula is only required for
                                                                            the organic product, not heptane.
             OR




             CH3CH2CH2CH2CH2CH2CH3                       4H2 ✔
                                                                            Accept any correctly balanced equation
                                                                            showing increased branching OR
                                                                            cyclization OR aromatization OR
                                                                            cracking.
                                                                                                                         3
             isomerisation/reforming/platforming/cracking ✔
                                                                            Suitable supports for catalysts may be
                                                                            included for M3 (eg silica, alumina,
             Pt/Re/Rh/Pd/Ir                                                 zeolite) but the symbol or name of an
                                                                            appropriate metal must be given
             OR
                                                                            (typically a noble metal). Ignore
             catalyst ✔                                                     temperature and other conditions.


                                                                            Award M2 AND M3 for “catalytic
                                                                            isomerisation” OR “catalytic reforming”
                                                                            OR “catalytic cracking”.
                                                                     – 26 –                                       N17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


  Question                                       Answers                                                         Notes                     Total
17.   b      which specific carbon-based greenhouse gases are included                          Ignore reference to geopolitical issues
             OR                                                                                 (eg false recording of data by
                                                                                                governments etc.).
             whether non-carbon based greenhouse gases should be included
             OR
             whether CO/incomplete combustion should be included «as can be oxidized to
             CO2»                                                                                                                            1
             OR
             how to “sum” all steps in a process creating CO2                                   Accept “difficult to measure all sources
                                                                                                of CO2” but not “difficult to measure
             OR                                                                                 CO2 released in atmosphere”.
             difficult to determine both direct and indirect production of GHG/greenhouse gas
             emissions ✔

17.   c      Any three of:                                                                      Do not accept “reflected” OR “bounced”
                                                                                                OR “trapped”.
             incoming solar radiation is short wavelength/high frequency/high energy/UV ✔
             radiated/emitted as long wavelength/low frequency/low energy/IR «radiation» ✔                                                 3 max
             energy/IR «radiation» absorbed by «bonds in» greenhouse gases ✔
             energy radiated/emitted as IR «radiation» some of which returns back to Earth ✔
                                                                         – 27 –                            N17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


  Question                                          Answers                                                Notes                    Total
18.   a   i    Fission: heavy nuclei AND Fusion: light nuclei ✔                           Accept “large nuclei” OR “greater
                                                                                          atomic masses of nuclei” for fission
               both increase in binding energy/energy yield «per nucleon» ✔               AND “small nuclei” OR “smaller atomic
                                                                                          masses of nuclei” for fusion.
                                                                                          Award [1 max] for “Fission: heavy           2
                                                                                          nuclei AND increase in binding energy
                                                                                          «per nucleon»” OR “Fusion: light nuclei
                                                                                          AND increase in binding energy” «per
                                                                                          nucleon»”.

18.   a   ii   Any two of:
               no/less radioactive waste produced ✔                                       Do not accept "no/less waste
                                                                                          produced".
               abundance/low cost of fuel ✔
               larger amounts of energy released per unit mass ✔                          Accept “higher specific energy”.          2 max
               does not require a critical mass ✔
               can be used continuously ✔
               fusion reactor less likely to cause large-scale technological disaster ✔

18.   b        6 «hours» ✔                                                                                                            1

  Question                                           Answers                                                   Notes                    Total
18.   c   i    Loss in mass:
               «(3.78532  10–25 kg – 9.109383  10–31 kg – 3.78528  10–25 kg)  0.00100 
               6.02  1023 »1.86  10–9 «kg» ✔
                                                                                                                                         2
               Energy released:
               «E  mc2  1.86  10–9 kg  (3.00  108 m s–1)2 » 1.67  108 «J» ✔

18.   c   ii                      7
               «1.67  108 J         » 1.46  108 «J» ✔                                                                                1
                                  8

18.   d        production of radicals/•O2–/•OH                                                Ignore missing dots on radical species.
               OR                                                                             Accept named radical eg “superoxide
                                                                                              radical” OR “hydroxyl radical”.
               direct effect such as breaking bonds/atom migration ✔                                                                     1
                                                                                              An example must be given for second
                                                                                              alternative.
                                                                      – 29 –                       N17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


  Question                                        Answers                                         Notes                      Total
19.   a                                                                          Catalyst not required for equation.




                                                                                                                               2


             ester product ✔
             glycerol AND correct balancing ✔                                    Award M2 only if M1 is correct.

19.   b      Any three of:                                                       M4 may also be scored from more
                                                                                 detailed answers involving iodide
             dye has conjugated system ✔
                                                                                 species (eg “iodide/I oxidized to
             dye absorbs a photon «and injects an electron into TiO2» ✔          I3/triiodide” OR “I/iodide reduces dye”
                                                                                 OR “I/iodide releases electron to dye”     3 max
             electrons transferred to semiconductor «and dye ionized» ✔
                                                                                 OR “I3/triiodide reduced to I/iodide”).
             dye oxidizes/takes electron from electrolyte ✔
             electron flows through external circuit «to reduce electrolyte» ✔
                                                                     – 30 –                        N17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


  Question                                         Answers                                         Notes                   Total
20.   a      Negative electrode (anode):                                          Accept any whole or fractional
                                                                                  coefficients in balanced equations.
             CH3OH (aq)  H2O (l)  CO2 (g)  6H (aq)  6e– ✔

                                                                                  Award [1 max] for correct half-
             Positive electrode (cathode):
                                                                                  equations at wrong electrodes for M1
                                                                                                                            3
             O2 (g)  4H (aq)  4e–  2H2O (l) ✔                                 and M2.


             Overall equation:
             2CH3OH (aq)  3O2 (g)  2CO2 (g)  4H2O (l) ✔

20.   b      Advantage:
             Any one of:
             liquid methanol is easier to transport/store than gaseous hydrogen   Ignore any cost references throughout.
             OR
             hydrogen is explosive ✔
             longer membrane life «as it operates in aqueous environment» ✔
             methanol has greater energy density than hydrogen ✔
                                                                                                                            2
                                                                                  Accept “CO2/greenhouse gas produced”
             Disadvantage:
                                                                                  OR “requires a more highly efficient
             Any one of:                                                          catalyst”.
             lower voltage ✔
             lower power per unit mass «of the cell» ✔                            Do not award marks for converse
                                                                                  statements for the advantage and
             lower efficiency ✔                                                   disadvantage.
             toxic/can be mistaken for ethanol ✔
             lower specific energy ✔

22.   a   i    C=O ✔                                                                    Accept “carbonyl”.                              1

22.   a   ii   X (must be identified) AND


               Any two of:
               For X:
               N–H «absorption» AND at 3300 – 3500 «cm1» ✔                             Accept any specific wavenumber in the
                                                                                        range 3300–3380 «cm－1» for M1.
               O–H «absorption» in phenol AND at 3200 – 3600 «cm-1» ✔
                                                                                        Accept any specific wavenumber in the         2 max
               absence of OH «absorption» in carboxylic acid AND 2500 – 3000 «cm1» ✔   range 3100–3200 «cm－1».

                                                                                        identified for paracetamol but if a correct
                                                                                        reason/reasons is/are given for the bond
                                                                                        absorption(s).

22.   b        prevents/interferes with the production of prostaglandins
               OR
               prevents/interferes with the production of substances responsible for                                                    2
               inflammation/pain/fever ✔
               at the site of injury/source of pain ✔
                                                                        – 34 –                                       N17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


  Question                                           Answers                                                         Notes                     Total
22.   c   i    react with CH3I/methyl iodide «in alkaline solution» ✔                               Accept “react with CH3Cl/methyl
                                                                                                    chloride” OR “react with methyl halide”.
                                                                                                    Accept name or formula of a suitable
                                                                                                    specific methylating reagent (eg
                                                                                                    trimethylphenylammonium chloride             1
                                                                                                    etc.).
                                                                                                    Accept “hydroxy/alcohol” but not
                                                                                                    “hydroxide” for “hydroxyl”.


22.   c   ii   Any two of:
               interact with opioid receptors in the brain ✔


               alter the structure of brain cells
               OR
               alter the way the brain works «so that it only works normally when the opiates are
               present»
               OR
                                                                                                                                               2 max
               prevents transmission of pain impulses inside the brain ✔


               release dopamine «that the person craves»
               OR
               give a feeling of pleasure/euphoria «that the person craves» ✔


               withdrawal symptoms «prevent patient from terminating drug use» ✔                    Accept specific withdrawal symptoms.

             in animal studies          AND in humans

             OR

             chiral auxiliary is optically active ✔
             is attached to non-optically active/non-chiral substrate ✔
                                                                                                             3 max
             creates stereochemical condition necessary to follow a certain pathway ✔
             allows only the required enantiomer to form «so avoids need to separate a
             racemic mixture» ✔

                                 
                               [A ]                     0.400
             pH  «pKa  log          » 6.35  log (            )✔                           Do not accept “pH = 8”.

             «pH » 7.65 ✔

             Ka  4.5  107 ✔

                                                                       – 37 –                                           N17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


  Question                                         Answers                                                              Notes                   Total
26.          ring is «sterically» strained
             OR
             angles of 90° instead of 109.5/109/120° angles
             OR
             angles smaller than 109.5/109/120°/tetrahedral/trigonal planar/triangular planar
             angle ✔


             ring breaks up/opens/reacts «easily»                                                                                                3
             OR
             amido/amide group «in ring» is «highly» reactive ✔


             binds to/reacts with/interferes with/inactivates transpeptidase
             OR
             binds to/reacts with/interferes with/inactivates enzyme responsible for bacterial cell
             wall formation/cross-linking ✔




27.          ethanol is oxidized «to ethanoic acid»                                                   Accept “ethanol reacts with oxygen” for
             OR                                                                                       M1.

             electrons are released ✔
                                                                                                                                                 2
                                                                                                      Accept “voltage” for “potential”.
             current/potential proportional to concentration «of ethanol»
             OR
             current compared to a reference «to determine concentration» ✔
